intro: Calochortus venustus, commonly known as the showy globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces distinctive, globe-shaped seed pods. Calochortus venustus is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
